title.narrative: OP 2. CAPACITY BUILDING FOR LOCAL MEDIA

description.narrative: Capacity of Lao national and provincial journalists in reporting on children issues improved through orientation, training and field visits to unicef supported program., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end 2016, families and communities, especially in areas that are remote, poor and populated by underserved ethnic groups, have increased demand for, and better access to, quality social services, within a supportive public and media environment.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity of Lao national and provincial journalists in reporting on children issues improved through orientation, training andfield visits to unicef supported program.

description.narrative: The increased awareness of the importance of effective communication, and the use of social media, is prompting ministries and mass organisations to update their capacity in order to be more effective. A good example of quality communication for a specific audience is the TV show “My Village”. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2017

title.narrative: By the end of 2014, children from all ethnic groups, pre-schools and Kindergartens around the country benefit from 15 new episodes of ECD TV that produced, broadcast, promoted and DVDs of 15 episodes are distributed

actual.value: 2016:43 (10 new episodes completed in 2016 per agreement with HQ)

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, National Committees and donor visits in UNICEF supported programmes are organized effectively and smoothly

actual.value: 2016:At least 4 donor visits took place in 2016 (UNICEF Australia, USAID, UNICEF Korea, Aeon).
